channel.title: Auto updater - 30% done come and help!
channel.description:
You can add this to your deob
so far I did this (Alittle to easy lol)
find 46# and replace all of it with verzion
go to the top and put in your ints put this
public static int verzion = 46#;
Needing help on -
getting an int to get to a diffrent class file

item.title: Auto updater - 30% done come and help!
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

So did I, I thought it was hilarious that 30% if a project is inserting an int into the client.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto updater - 30% done come and help!
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

Lmfao, I think he meant within the source code.
Also, if modifying the internal version so it can be used with the new server (minus packet-changes and so-forth) you would want to make the version number a constant (static int), then you can simply reference it through CLASS_NAME.VERSION or whatever.

Read full topic
item.source: Auto updater - 30% done come and help!

item.title: Auto updater - 30% done come and help!
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

To move a field to another class, you need to change the class index of every constantfieldref to the class index of your new class.

Read full topic
item.source: Auto updater - 30% done come and help!

item.title: Auto updater - 30% done come and help!
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

i assume this is in client. java, so declare the version variable public and access it through:

client.versionVar

also, what exactly are you planning to do here?

Read full topic
